exclusion: Put controller into exclusion mode and triple click S1 switch
inclusion: Put controller into inclusion mode and triple click S1 switch
label: FGS213
overview:
FIBARO Switch 2 is designed to be installed in standard wall switch boxes or anywhere else where it is necessary to control electric devices. It allows to control connected devices either via the Z-Wave+ network or via a switch connected directly to it and is equipped with active power and energy consumption metering functionality.

Main features of FIBARO Switch 2:

  • Compatible with any Z-Wave or Z-Wave+ Controller,
  • Supports protected mode (Z-Wave network security mode) with
  • AES-128 encryption,
  • Advanced microprocessor control,
  • Active power and energy metering functionality,
  • Works with various types of switches – momentary, toggle, three-way, etc,
  • To be installed in wall switch boxes of dimensions allowing for installation, conforming to provisions of applicable regulations,
  • FIBARO Switch 2 is an extension unit

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: Restore state after power failure
parameters.description: Restore state after power failure
parameters.overview: This parameter determines if the device will return to state prior to the power failure after power is restored.

parameters.label: First channel operating mode
parameters.description: First channel - operating mode
parameters.overview: This parameter allows to choose operating for the 1st channel controlled by the S1 switch.

parameters.label: 1st ch. reaction to switch
parameters.description: First channel - reaction to switch for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
parameters.overview: This parameter determines how the device in timed mode reacts to pushing the switch connected to the S1 terminal.

options.label: cancel mode and set target state
no reaction to switch - mode runs until it ends
reset timer - start counting from the beginning

parameters.label: time parameter for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
parameters.description: First channel - time parameter for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
parameters.overview:
This parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes.

Available settings: 0 (0.1s), 1-32000 (1-32000s, 1s step) - time parameter

Default setting: 50 (50s)

parameters.label: 1st ch. pulse time for flashing mode
parameters.description: First channel - pulse time for flashing mode
parameters.overview:
This parameter allows to set time of switching to opposite state in flashing mode

Available settings: 1-32000 (0.1-3200.0s, 0.1s step) - time parameter

Default setting: 5 (0.5s)

parameters.label: Switch type
parameters.description: Switch type
parameters.overview: This parameter defines as what type the device should treat the switch connected to the S1 and S2 terminals

parameters.label: Flashing mode - reports
parameters.description: Flashing mode - reports

options.label: the device does not send reports

parameters.label: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
parameters.description: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
parameters.overview: This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. This parameter does not apply to 1st „Lifeline” group.

parameters.label: S1 switch - scenes sent
parameters.description: S1 switch - scenes sent
parameters.overview: This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them

options.label: Key Hold Down and Key Released

parameters.label: S2 switch - scenes sent
parameters.description: S2 switch - scenes sent
parameters.overview: This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them

options.label: Key Hold Down and Key Released

parameters.label: S1 assocs. sent to 2nd and 3rd group
parameters.description: S1 switch - associations sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
parameters.overview: This parameter determines which actions are ignored when sending commands to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group. All actions are active by default.

options.label: All actions are active by default
ignore turning ON with 1 click of the switch
ignore turning OFF with 1 click of the switch
ignore holding and releasing the switch
ignore double click of the switch

parameters.label: S1 ON val sent to 2nd and 3rd groups
parameters.description: S1 switch - Switch ON value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups

parameters.label: S1 OFF val sent to 2nd and 3rd groups
parameters.description: S1 switch - Switch ON value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
parameters.overview: This parameter defines value sent with Switch OFF command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.

parameters.label: S1 DblClick val sent to 2nd and 3rd groups
parameters.description: S1 switch - Double Click value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups

parameters.label: S2 assocs. sent to 4th and 5th group
parameters.description: S2 switch - associations sent to 4th and 5th association groups
parameters.overview: This parameter determines which actions result in sending commands to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group. All actions are active by default.

options.label: All actions are active by default
ignore turning on with 1 click of the switch
ignore turning off with 1 click of the switch
ignore holding and releasing the switch
ignore double click of the switch

parameters.label: S2 switch ON value sent to 4th and 5th ass. groups
parameters.description: S2 switch - Switch ON value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
parameters.overview: This parameter defines value sent with Switch On command to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group.

parameters.label: S2 switch OFF sent to 4th and 5th groups
parameters.description: S2 switch - Switch OFF value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
parameters.overview: This parameter defines value sent with Switch OFF command to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group.

parameters.label: S2 double click sent to 4th and 5th ass. grps.
parameters.description: S2 switch - Double Click value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
parameters.overview: This parameter defines value sent with Double Click command to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group.

parameters.label: Reaction to General Alarm
parameters.description: Reaction to General Alarm
parameters.overview: This parameter determines how the device will react to General Alarm frame.

parameters.label: Reaction to Flood Alarm
parameters.description: Reaction to Flood Alarm
parameters.overview: This parameter determines how the device will react to Flood Alarm frame.

parameters.label: CO/CO2/Smoke Alarm
parameters.description: Reaction to CO/CO2/Smoke Alarm
parameters.overview: This parameter determines how the device will react to CO, CO2 or Smoke frame.

parameters.label: Reaction to Heat Alarm
parameters.description: Reaction to Heat Alarm
parameters.overview: This parameter determines how the device will react to Heat Alarm frame.

parameters.label: Flashing alarm duration
parameters.description: Flashing alarm duration
parameters.overview: This parameter allows to set duration of flashing alarm mode.  (1-32000s duration, 1s step). The default value (600) represents 10 minutes.

parameters.label: Active power reports
parameters.description: Power level reporting threshold.
parameters.overview: The parameter defines the power level change that will result in a new power report being sent. The value is a percentage of the previous report. 0 disables the function.

parameters.label: Minimal time between power report
parameters.description: Determines minimal time between power reports
parameters.overview: This  parameter determines minimum time that has to elapse before sending new power report to the main controller. 0 disables the function. 1-120s - report interval in seconds

parameters.label: Energy reports
parameters.description: Energy level change resulting in sending a new energy report.
parameters.overview: Energy level change which will result in sending a new energy report. Available settings: 1-32000 (0.01 - 320 kWh). 0 disables the function.

parameters.label: Periodic power reports
parameters.description: Determines time interval for periodic power reports
parameters.overview: This  parameter  determines  in  what  time  interval  the  periodic  power   reports are sent to the main controller. 0  - periodic reports are disabled, 1-32000  (1-32000s) - report interval

parameters.label: Periodic energy reports
parameters.description: Determines time interval for periodic energy reports
parameters.overview: This parameter determines in what time interval the periodic energy reports are sent to the main controller. 0  - periodic reports are disabled 1-32000  (1-32000s) - report interval

parameters.label: Measuring energy consumed by the device itself
parameters.description: Determines if energy consumed by device should be included
parameters.overview: This parameter determines whether energy metering should include  the amount of energy consumed by the device itself. Results are be - ing added to energy reports for first endpoint. 0: Function deactivated 1: Function activated

associations.label: Switch 1
associations.overview: This is assigned to the switch connected to the S1 terminal (uses Basic command class).

associations.label: Switch 2
associations.overview: This is assigned to the switch connected to the S2 terminal (uses Basic command class).

associations.label: Dimmer 2
associations.overview: This is assigned to the switch connected to the S2 terminal (uses Switch Multilevel command class).
